google_play_reviews.content: Thank you Konrad! Your app just saved my day (Long story.. ;-)
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for the positive feedback. I'm glad that the app could help you :-)! I am interested in the long story, maybe you can send it via mail to me ;-)

google_play_reviews.content: Took some help from the developer, but figured out how to get notes to sync. Turns out that every Notebook created at the root level must have its own account login in the app, in order to sync. However, if you create sub-folders of a root folder, all those are included with that login.  In any case, updating my review, as this app works as I need it to. I would like to see rich-text formatting follow through in the app, however. For example bulleted lists don't render correctly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, I am sorry that you are not pleased with the app. But I cannot reproduce the problem. Do you use Kolab Now or a self hosted Kolab server?

Maybe you can file an issue on the projects website with more details: https://github.com/konradrenner/kolabnotes-android/issues

google_play_reviews.content: Sync overwrites newer updates from other clients, breaks line endings,  replaces non-English characters by question marks and syncs that back...  Love the idea of the app, hate losing notes like this.  Update / reply: I installed it together with getting a KolabNow account. My desktop client and KMail had been syncing the notes just fine, but as soon as I access them through Kolab Notes things go wrong. Even notes that were originally created there. The bits replaced by '?' chars was a Cyrillic address... I can understand not being able to display it, but finding out the address was gone in every client was less understandable. Worse so as I didn't actually modify the notes in Android, just opening them was apparently enough to trigger it. The overwriting issue is already in the Kolab bug tracker, I first thought it might be on their side. We did tests and the issue only occurs when Kolab Notes touches the note. Line endings are being converted to spaces in random moments, same thing there, without even editing a note, just reading triggers it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I am sorry for the problems you have using the app. Thx for the clarifactions about the problems. One problem is, that kmail doesn't work with html formatted notes (but the webclient does!). The default in the app is, that it uses html formatted notes, but you can disable it. This should solves many of your problems.

google_play_reviews.content: It is a good notebook app. Renaming notebooks will make it more better, if that can be implemented.  Desktop Sync is also missing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for the feedback! For desktop sync you can use the official Kolab client for tasks/notes (https://zanshin.kde.org) or you can use this experimental app https://github.com/konradrenner/kolabnotes-fx

google_play_reviews.content: There is no apparent way to create an account, there's no way to deselect local, and thus no way to configure it for sync. App should be able to create new accounts directly, it should not require going into the android settings themselves and going through the add account process there, it is counterintuitive.  EDIT: Issue largely remains, there is still no real feedback or guidance on adding accounts, though there is now a link below "change account" titled "system sync settings" which takes you to the sy
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, please update the app with the new version app it is possible the create an account from the app settings.I hope the app is you now more worth than 3 Stars ;-).
Yours, Konrad
